org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.json

Class JsonVeluxBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridge
      • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.json.JsonVeluxBridge

  • @NonNullByDefault
public class JsonVeluxBridge
extends VeluxBridge
    JSON-based 2nd Level I/O interface towards the Velux bridge.

    It provides methods for pre- and postcommunication as well as a common method for the real communication.

    The following class access methods exist:

    • VeluxBridge.bridgeLogin() for pre-communication,
    • VeluxBridge.bridgeLogout() for post-communication,
    • VeluxBridge.bridgeCommunicate(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.common.BridgeCommunicationProtocol, boolean) as method for the common communication.

    As root of several inheritance levels it predefines an interfacing method VeluxBridge.bridgeAPI() which has to be implemented by any kind of protocol-specific communication returning the appropriate base (1st) level communication method as well as any other gateway interaction.

    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

    • Method Detail

      • bridgeAPI

        public BridgeAPI bridgeAPI()
        Provides information about the base-level communication method and any kind of available gateway interactions.

        Note: the implementation within this class JsonVeluxBridge as inherited from VeluxBridge will return the protocol-specific class implementations.

        The information will be initialized by the corresponding API class JsonBridgeAPI.

        Specified by:
        bridgeAPI in class VeluxBridge
        Returns:
        bridgeAPI of type BridgeAPI contains all possible methods.

      • bridgeDirectCommunicate

        protected boolean bridgeDirectCommunicate(BridgeCommunicationProtocol communication,
                                          boolean useAuthentication)
        Method as implementation of abstract superclass method.

        Initializes a client/server communication towards Velux veluxBridge based on the Basic I/O interface io(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, U, java.lang.Class<T>) and parameters passed as arguments (see below).

        Specified by:
        bridgeDirectCommunicate in class VeluxBridge
        Parameters:
        communication - Structure of interface type JsonBridgeCommunicationProtocol describing the intended communication, that is request and response interactions as well as appropriate URL definition.
        useAuthentication - boolean flag to decide whether to use authenticated communication.
        Returns:
        success of type boolean which signals the success of the communication.

      • lastCommunication

        Returns:

      • bridgeDirectCommunicate

        private boolean bridgeDirectCommunicate(JsonBridgeCommunicationProtocol communication,
                                        boolean useAuthentication)
        Initializes a client/server communication towards Velux veluxBridge based on the Basic I/O interface VeluxBridge and parameters passed as arguments (see below).
        Parameters:
        communication - Structure of interface type JsonBridgeCommunicationProtocol describing the intended communication, that is request and response interactions as well as appropriate URL definition.
        useAuthentication - boolean flag to decide whether to use authenticated communication.
        Returns:
        response of type boolean will indicate the success of the communication.

      • io

        private <T,U> T io(java.lang.String url,
                   java.lang.String authentication,
                   U request,
                   java.lang.Class<T> classOfResponse)
            throws com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Base level communication with the Velux bridge.
        Type Parameters:
        T - This describes the request type parameter.
        U - This describes the response type parameter.
        Parameters:
        url - as String describing the Service Access Point location i.e. http://localhost/api .
        authentication - as String providing the Authentication token to be passed with the request header.
        request - as Object representing the structure of the message request body to be converted into JSON.
        classOfResponse - as Class representing the expected structure of the message response body to be converted from JSON.
        Returns:
        response of type Object containing all resulting informations, i.e. device status, errors a.s.o. Will return null in case of communication or decoding error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of continuous communication I/O failures.
        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - in case of unusual communication failures.

        private <T,U> T ioAuthenticated(java.lang.String url,

                                U request,
                                java.lang.Class<T> classOfResponse)

        Returns:
        response of type T containing all resulting informations, i.e. device status, errors a.s.o. Will return null in case of communication or decoding error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of continuous communication I/O failures.
